column1: I used to be addicted to frozen sandwiches but I decided to go cold turkey.
column3: The word cold refers to both the temperature (frozen) and the abrupt cessation of something (cold turkey).
column4: The cold wind blew harshly across the field.
column5: She decided to go cold turkey after years of smoking.

column1: A prisoner was told how hell be executed needless to say, he was shocked.
column3: The word shocked refers to both being surprised and a physical reaction to an electric shock.
column4: He was shocked to learn the truth about his familys history.
column5: The technician was shocked when he accidentally touched the live wire.

column1: **Note**: Only the first two jokes fit entirely into your criteria. If you would like me to continue with more examples or different jokes, please let me know!
